There's a watermark for the program that was used to rip the streaming video.  Granted it only comes up from time to time...but it's more than once.  It's on more than one of the episodes...perhaps on all of them, don't know yet.  Watermark says it's a trial version.  Funny that the ripper/encoder didn't crack the program before posting it on THEPIRATEBAY...kind of ironic if you think about it.

I don't blame dibyatpb...he is an awesome uploader.  And these are still the best quality (still disappointed about no surround sound though) on here.  Will continue to download rest of the season.

Meech, AD was put out with this watermark on it to fool people like you; watch it on netflix it will have the watermark.
death it did? funny I've had it for years and years and years.

yes i was fooled.  How was I supposed to know.  What a funny joke...not really.  Downloading off piratebay, i can handle things like this from time to time (ala screeners)...but if i paid for netflix streaming, i wouldn't be too thrilled at the joke.  It's kind of more annoying than funny, if you ask me.

Look at the people who don't understand the "Showstealer Pro Trial Version" joke. 

I hope you people don't actually call yourselves AD fans...

Understand and appreciate are two different things.  And yes, I call myself an "AD" fan...so your hopes are crushed.  I love Arrested Development and yes I "get" the humor.

But this joke...flash it up once or twice...classic Arrested Development humor...i get it (now that I know it was intentional...if you say that you got the joke before reading about it online, i say I don't believe you).

Saying the same joke over and over through multiple episodes...it's just not AD style if you ask me.  The joke just gets old quick.  AD is all about intelligent, quick and wit.  If you're still laughing the 10th time you see this, I hope you don't call yourself an AD fan.

Just some tips on how to convert this to an MKV for  those inclined.

I couldn't get Ripbot264 to accept these files as is without complaining about the audio... (you might have better luck with Handbrake)

Used TSMuxer to Demux the audio and video into separate files.

Deleted the original .ts files

Used XVID4PSP to convert the aac audio to AC3 audio. (you could use another tool that converts AAC to AC3)

Deleted the aac files

Loaded the Video file, and the AC3 audio file into Ripbot264, and encoded to MKV.
